alert.note: Alert for Coastal Indian River; Coastal St. Lucie; Inland Indian River; Inland St. Lucie; Okeechobee (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 24 at 6:21PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern St. Lucie, northeast Okeechobee and southern Indian River Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 620 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles east of Fort Drum, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fort Pierce, Vero Beach, Vero Beach South, Gifford and Pointe West. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. These types of funnel clouds are harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for east central Florida.
